I'd quite like to see the new continent, the new class features, and the expanded Skyriding.
Read more
articles.title: World Of Warcraft's latest expansion The War Within is live, adding a new continent, hero talents and Delves

articles.author: Edwin Evans-Thirlwell
articles.description:
This morning I left my torpid flat in search of coffee, sniffed the restive wind, noted with approval the gloom gathering beneath the trees, and thought: at last, summer is over. At last, we quit the disgusting sunlit months. At last we leave all that is green and good behind, and return to the time of monsters.
Supermassive Games and Behaviour Interactive must have gotten the memo too. They've just released a demo for their next horror game The Casting Of Frank Stone, in which you are a policeman, Sam Green, who is investigating the disappearance of a child. The search leads you to Cedar Hills Steel Mill, "where chilling secrets await, revealing a far more sinister truth than anyone could have anticipated". I am anticipating: QTEs during escape sequences, branching choices that get people killed, and General Mature Content appropriate to the coming of Halloween.
 Read more
articles.title: Here's a demo for Dead By Daylight spin-off The Casting Of Frank Stone, from the makers of Until Dawn

articles.author: Edwin Evans-Thirlwell
articles.description:
If you live in the UK, you may have noticed that this week is shy a working day. Credulous fools attribute this to the existence of a "bank holiday" on Monday 26th, but true initiates like ourselves know the sobering truth: the Maw has eaten one of our weekdays. We have dispatched our finest gastronauts equipped with extremely long pairs of tweezers to retrieve the missing Monday from the Maw's bowels. We can only hope it hasn't been digested yet - imagine living in a world with a four-day working week? The horror. Anyway, here are this week's PC game releases of note.
Read more
articles.title: The Maw: what's new in PC games this week?

articles.author: Edwin Evans-Thirlwell
articles.description:
Almost a decade after his acrimonious departure from Konami, the shadow of Hideo Kojima still looms over Metal Gear Solid. He's there, barely camouflaged, in the undergrowth of Metal Gear Solid Delta: Snake Eater - a remake of the fifth Metal Gear game, originally released in 2004, which tells the tale of a lone US special operator hunting superweapons and old mentors in the jungles of the southern Soviet Union. 


I say "remake" but this feels more like a re-release, in spirit. True, it now runs on Unreal Engine, with the option of a manual, third-person perspective and cover-shooter controls in addition to the old top-down viewpoints. Yes, it boasts new flourishes, such as wounds now leaving scars, and clothes picking up stray leaves. Yes, there's a new interface with floating in-world menus, which makes shuffling between the layers a bit less awkward. It's the product of much labour, with development split between Konami and external support partner Virtuos. But where Konami's other big restoration project, Bloober's Silent Hill 2 remake, is a creative dialogue with the original game, Delta seems consumed by faithfulness to Kojima's original design.

 
Read more
articles.title: Does Metal Gear Solid need a new Kojima? Konami have “many people” in mind, but it's "difficult"

articles.author: Nic Reuben
articles.description:
Hello reader who is also a reader, and welcome back to Booked For The Week - our regular Sunday chat with a selection of cool industry folks about books! As is customary, I must jam my new cat into every article. I’ve tried to offer her several books, but she’s failed to turn even a single page so far. What a big dumbo. The best dumbo. The sweetest, smartest dumbo in the world, yes she is. Ahem. This week, it’s Supermassive, Niantic, and Sensible Object narrative designer and Limit Break mentor, Anastasia Dukakis! Cheers Ana! Mind if we have a nose at your bookshelf?
Read more
articles.title: What's on your bookshelf?: Supermassive and Niantic narrative designer Anastasia Dukakis

articles.author: Nic Reuben
articles.description:
Sundays are for more cat. She’s flop and headbutt-level comfortable around me now, but she still seems a bit terrified of my house in general. I’m going to hang out with her a bunch and see if I can instill some sort of object permanence re: my presence in the home. Before that, let’s read this week’s best writing about games (and game related things!)
Read more
articles.title: The Sunday Papers

articles.author: Graham Smith
articles.description:
Stranger Video is a website that wants access to your webcam. Grant it and it will show you a close-up of your own face, the background around you cropped out. Close your eyes to tell it you're ready, and open them again when you hear a chime. It'll now connect you to a stranger doing the same thing: first person to blink loses.

You can play it here.

 
Read more
articles.title: Let's have a staring contest

articles.author: Graham Smith
articles.description:
Valve have their own rating system for measuring how games run on Steam Deck, but even following the guidance of whether something is "Playable" or "Verified", I've still run into games that simply do not work on the handheld device.

Enter Steam reviews. Reviews from players who primarily played on Steam Deck will now have a little Deck icon, which when moused over tells you the exact amount of time spent on the Deck.

 
Read more
articles.title: You can now filter Steam reviews to show those who "played mostly on Steam Deck"

articles.author: Graham Smith
articles.description:
Tens of thousands of people have been playing Deadlock, a new multiplayer shooter from Valve, for the past several months, but in that time there's been no official announcement or acknowledgement of the game's existence by its creators. Until now. Valve have posted an extremely barebones Steam store page for Deadlock, describing it as a "multiplayer game in early development."

 
Read more
articles.title: Deadlock, Valve's new multiplayer shooter, now has a barebones Steam page

articles.author: Edwin Evans-Thirlwell
articles.description:
Hello hello hello! This is Edwin chatting. I don't usually get to do these weekend features, but Ollie and James are busy working their magic (stripmining Black Myth: Wukong for guides and fleeing Gamescom), while Nic can't type complete words anymore without getting his hands eaten (see latest domestic update, below). I know that Ollie usually does a picture puzzle for you, but I am comparatively innocent in the ways of Photoshop and more importantly, very lazy - so lazy that I can't think of an elegant way to complete this paragraph, and will proceed immediately to stating: here's what we're all playing this weekend.
 
Read more
articles.title: What are we all playing this weekend?

articles.author: Edwin Evans-Thirlwell
articles.description:
If you like jumping on enveloping pixelly architecture while basking in an atmosphere of pathological sadness, set aside some time on 20th September, because that’s when Rubeki's first-person spelunker Lorn’s Lure launches on Steam. Ah, I've been waiting a while for this one. Catch a new trailer below.
 Read more
articles.title: Amazingly grim retro sci-fi android spelunker Lorn’s Lure finally has a release date

articles.author: Edwin Evans-Thirlwell
articles.description:
Everything I know about the French Revolution has hitherto come from two literary works: Hilary Mantel's excellent doorstopper A Place Of Greater Safety, and Kate Beaton's webcomics. Neither Mantel nor Beaton mention mechs, which are a core feature of Studio Imugi's new "ideology driven" turn-based strategy game Bonaparte: A Mechanized Revolution. I, for one, feel like I've been grossly ill-informed. Kate, Hilary - I've been quoting you for years at parties and it seems like all this time, people have been silently judging me for my ignorance of the role giant clockwork soldiers played in the fall of the Bastille.
 Read more
articles.title: Turn-based strategy game Bonaparte wants to redo the French Revolution, but this time with mechs

articles.author: James Archer
articles.description:
"Age of Empires with dinosaurs" is, the developers of the Dinolords recently told me in a cramped Gamescom booth, a flattering description for their upcoming England vs. Vikingsaurus RTS. It’s also not a terribly accurate one. From what I saw of the game, Dinolords is more about the lords than the dinos, having as much in common with Diablo-style ARPGs as it does with classic strategy. And that’s a distinction which might just elevate it out of novelty status.
Read more
articles.title: T-Rexes aren’t the only twist that Dinolords puts on medieval strategy

articles.author: Edwin Evans-Thirlwell
articles.description:
Take the ballroom scene from Disney's Beauty And The Beast, swap the wailing utensils for an army of chibi cats, endow Belle with low-key Doctor Manhattan-grade powers of matter transformation, and you're perhaps beginning to approximate the experience of Infinity Nikki - an open world dress-up adventure from Singapore-based Infold and former Legend of Zelda: Breath Of The Wild developer Kentaro Tominaga.
Trailered this week at Gamescom 2024, it's the fifth installment in the hitherto mobile-focussed Nikki series and it's seemingly going down a storm, with over 12 million pre-registrations so far (albeit, many of them motivated by the prospect of collectively unlocked in-game bonuses). It's also a free-to-play game, and I have the usual unanswered questions about currencies and gacha, but I'm willing to give it the benefit of the doubt for the minute, because I have not spent nearly enough of my life considering the tactical applications of ballgowns. Here's that trailer.
 
Read more
articles.title: Glamtime never ends in Infinity Nikki, the open world dress-up game from Zelda talent

articles.author: James Archer
articles.description:
A few months back, I enjoyed lurking a conversation on the RPS Discord about the proliferation of cyberpunk/steampunk/atompunk/what-have-you-punk variants and how most of them in fact lack the rebelliousness and counter-counter elements that punk actually entails. That discussion was back on my mind as I sat down to play Reignbreaker, a new action-roguelike from Studio Fizbin, at Gamescom 2024 – slightly wary of its self-described medievalpunk styling. However! Turns out you’re trying to kill the queen. Yep, that’s, uh, that’s pretty punk.
Read more
articles.title: Reignbreaker is an anti-establishment roguelike that’s clearly pro-Hades

articles.author: Ed Thorn
articles.description:
I can guarantee you that a zombie survival game called God Save Birmingham wasn't on your "2024 Video Game Announcements" bingo card. It takes place in 14th century England, and tasks you with fending off the rampant zombie hordes of a populace who've succumbed to a mysterious case of reanimation. Perhaps the cause is that there's no Maccies or TK Maxx at the local Bull Ring yet.
Read more
articles.title: Here's an open world zombie survival game set in medieval.... Birmingham?

articles.author: Nic Reuben
articles.description:
I’m still a little giddy over how much I enjoyed lucarne-lobbing puzzler Tactical Breach Wizards. So much so that I mentioned in my review how I’m well up for another run of its fifteen hour campaign. I’d already got a few missions into hard mode. There's no more starting mana points! It’s a real...pane.
Now, I might have to start again, even if going out of my way to grab the tapes added in its developer's commentary mode is going to be extra tricky. Ah, but will being able to chuck the recorders at my enemies for a point of knockback afterwards make up for it?
 
Read more
articles.title: Even Tactical Breach Wizards' developer commentary can be used to knock people out of windows

articles.author: Brendan Caldwell
articles.description:
Earlier this year, Bungie's 1990s sci-fi shooter, Marathon, came to Steam for free. And Marathon 2 followed in July. But this series is a trilogy. Where's the third one? I want the thir-- oh, it's here now. Yesterday, the final game, Marathon Infinity trickled onto the storefront, offering a neat little bundle for fans of retro shooters. But it's also a reminder that we've yet to see more of Bungie's upcoming reboot.
Read more
articles.title: The full original Marathon trilogy is now free on Steam, but Bungie are still quiet on the reboot

articles.author: Edwin Evans-Thirlwell
articles.description:
One of my formative video game moments is the final mission of Psygnosis cyberpunk flight sim G-Police. (It came out in 1997, and as such, I think the statute of limitations on spoilers has passed, but if you still intend to play, stop reading now.) The mission completes the long arc of foreshadowing begun by the intro's mention that capital-class spacecraft have been outlawed, following a ruinous war. It turns out that one particular evil corpo has been sneakily building one of these megaships - not only that, but you get to fly inside it, cannons ablazing. It was while doing so that teenage me realised the true exceptionality of the Video Game Artform. You can't fly inside capital ships in, like, symbolist poems or baroque symphonies, can you? You can't fly in poems or symphonies at all, unless you do so metaphorically - "metaphor" being a kind of poor man's graphics card.
The technology of flight simming has advanced mightily since G-Police's day. For instance: in Everspace 2's just-announced Titans DLC, you get to fly inside not just regular old spaceships, but massive space kaiju with procedurally generated digestive systems. Here's the trailer.
Read more
articles.title: Everspace 2 turns Monster Hunter with secret nebula-dwelling kaiju that are essentially living procgen dungeons

articles.author: Ed Thorn
articles.description:
Assassin's Creed: Valhalla, Odyssey, and Origins all have one thing in common: they've got a Discovery mode, which replaces murdering with learning. You can, quite literally, go on tours curated by historians around each of the game's respective maps. Instead of diving off a Sphinx and plunging your hidden blade into someone's spinal column, you can look up at the Sphinx and read a paragraph on its significance. Maybe view an actual, real life bit of ancient Egypt from an actual real life museum collection in-game. Perhaps embody an Anglo-Saxon lad in Valhalla, instead, and like, cook up some nettle soup having just got a fresh "Friar Tuck" at the local hair choppers (no guarantees on this last bit).
This is all to say that Black Myth: Wukong deserves such a mode, too. There were so many times throughout my review time where I stopped and stared and wondered as to something's meaning. Not only in the architecture, but in the characters, too. So here I am with a proposition: how about instead of thwacking things with my staff, I can use it as a walking stick and point it at things I want to learn about.
Read more
articles.title: Black Myth: Wukong needs an Assassin's Creed-style discovery mode

articles.author: Graham Smith
articles.description:
We haven't written about Diplomacy Is Not An Option since it launched in Early Access in 2022, when it was a light and frothy strategy game about smashing thousands of peasants to bits with physics magic. It's still that, but now it's getting a 1.0 release on October 4th.

 
Read more
articles.title: Diplomacy Is Not An Option's castle-building spectacle-strategy gets a 1.0 release October 4th

articles.author: Graham Smith
articles.description:
We've been distracted by Gamescom, several game releases, the rapid dwindling of the British summer. Or I assume we have, for why else would we not have yet posted about the Steam Rhythm Fest, which began on Monday and runs until August 26th at 10am PT/6pm BRDST*.

 
Read more
articles.title: Steam Rhythm Fest is underway with discounts and demos for games with a good beat

articles.author: Graham Smith
articles.description:
I recently wrote about a game that aimed to recreate the old magic of Tokyo Xtreme Racer, a series of late-night, urban racing games that hadn't had a new (non-mobile) entry in 18 years. Oh, what a neglected niche those indie developers were filling!

Yeah, a new Tokyo Xtreme Racer was just announced from original developers Genki, and it's targeting a Steam release next year.

 
Read more
articles.title: Tokyo Xtreme Racer is returning after 18 years, with a new game coming to Steam next year

articles.author: Edwin Evans-Thirlwell
articles.description:
Ubisoft have announced Heroes of Might & Magic: Olden Era, a fresh instalment in the exceedingly olden turn-based strategy RPG series, which began life under New World Computing in 1995. The new game will “return to the world of Enroth and the origins of the legendary saga”, inviting “both veterans and new players” to go on a quest to Jadame, “a mysterious continent in turmoil”. Expect new factions, biomes and creatures, together with such M&M standbys as castle management, army clashes, hex-based maps, and, who knows, maybe some heroes.
 Read more
articles.title: Ubisoft announce new back-to-roots Heroes of Might & Magic game with the Iratus devs in charge

articles.author: Edwin Evans-Thirlwell
articles.description:
If you've been necromantically dreaming of a Callisto Protocol sequel, I'm afraid the monkey paw finger hasn't just curled - it's jammed itself right up your nose and scratched an FU on your hypothalamus. Developers Striking Distance and publishers Krafton have revealed [REDACTED], a scifi roguelike dungeon crawler set in the same universe.
The square brackets are part of the title, yes, and they're also calling it "punk rock" - a combination of factors that fills me with a rage so obliterating, I can barely perceive the announcement trailer, below. It's a machinegun montage of comicbook panels and sizzling melee arcs and quips like "there's a lot of wankers between you and the sweet taste of freedom". I didn't even like The Callisto Protocol that much but still, what have they done to you, boy? Where did all the horror game go?
 Read more
articles.title: The Callisto Protocol series returns as... top-down roguelike geezer shooter [REDACTED]

articles.author: Nic Reuben
articles.description:
It is perhaps deeply ungrateful of me that, when presented with the squirrel with a gun of Squirrel With A Gun, my immediate reaction is to thrust out my bowl like a ballsy victorian urchin and ask for additional squirrel information. It’s not that developer Dee Dee Creations haven’t shown off the game in action. It’s just that I find myself rooting so hard for this not to just be a vapid bit of meme-ware that I’m getting more concerned as we rapidly approach its 29th August release.
Read more
articles.title: I’m rooting for you Squirrel With A Gun, but you still won’t explain yourself

articles.author: Nic Reuben
articles.description:
I shouldn’t be too surprised really. If a park sim based on Tim Burton’s 1996 B-Movie homage Mars Attacks wasn’t on my bingo card, it’s because I’ve recently binned it and replaced it with a bobble head that simply nods in amused acceptance at whatever videogames decide to do next. And conceptually, Jurassic World Evolution with captive humans instead of dinos isn’t not a potential winner, is it? Still, I was mildly bemused to learn that Mars Attracts, coming sometime next year, is the film’s first licensed game. But then I realised that I’d never thought to check before, which might go some way to explaining the lack of them. Do you reckon they did the pun then worked backwards from there? Respectable, honestly.
Read more
articles.title: New theme park manager Mars Attracts is the oddest bit of IP necromancy I’ve seen in quite some time

articles.author: Edwin Evans-Thirlwell
articles.description:
Earlier today, old man James wagged a finger at us all sternly for not writing about Atomfall before. My turn to puff out my cheeks and look not angry, just disappointed: why haven't we covered The Stone Of Madness prior to the below Gamescom 2024 story trailer? I mean, it's only a real-time tactical stealth game set in a cursed 18th century Jesuit monastery, developed by the people behind gorgeously gross metroidvania Blasphemous. It's only got isometric art inspired by Goya and a sanity/trauma system redolent of Darkest Dungeon. Sounds like an automatic RPS write-up to me. 
 Read more
articles.title: The Blasphemous dev's new Goya-fuelled stealth tactics monastery sim is basically Umberto Eco's The Great Escape

articles.author: Ed Thorn
articles.description:
Remember that puzzle game Unravel and its star: a cute lad made of yarn called Yarny? He'd tackle headscratchers by unwinding the very fabric of his body, similar to how a human being might feed their intestines through a karabiner and use it as a tether for a spot of rock climbing. Well, some of the minds behind Unravel are working on new game called Hela. This time it's less about yarn and more about being a small mouse who does parkour. Still, it does retain some of the bodily gymnastics of its predecessor. Namely the use of tongues as bungee ropes.
Read more
articles.title: Former Unravel devs announce Scandinavian parkour mouse sim where you can walk on tongues

articles.author: Brendan Caldwell
articles.description:
I've yet to discover a SteamWorld game I don't like. Whether plundering the earth in SteamWorld Dig 2 or mucking about with magic in SteamWorld Quest, these are solid and approachable adventures that enthusiastically embrace whatever theme the developers have decided upon. Cowboys? Sure. Wizards? Why not. It barely matters, as long as it results in some good puns. As a studio, Thunderful have a reputation for hopping from one style of game to the next, boiling entire genres down to their essence, and reconstituting them with competence and style to exist within a now-familiar steampunk world of colourful pals and Saturday morning cartoon jokes. The studio is a perpetual notion machine. Yes, with SteamWorld Heist 2, they're revisiting the sci-fi bullet-bouncing of their 2016 tactics game SteamWorld Heist, but they're also introducing significant changes to create a compulsive XCOM-like full of sea-faring submariners that may be their best work yet, even against a back catalogue of blinders. 
Read more
articles.title: SteamWorld Heist 2 review: a tactical trick shot across the bow of lesser strategy games

articles.author: Edwin Evans-Thirlwell
articles.description:
If you're feeling very rested and at peace today, I do not recommend you play the demo for just-announced puzzle game Wilmot Works It Out. It will relax you so much that you gently petrify. Future archaeologists will marvel at you, a smiling stone figure in the ruins of a bygone civilisation. "What exactly was going on back in 2024 to inspire such a critical intensity of chillax?" they will wonder. Then, they will spot the computer screen glowing beneath its layer of dust, and the cycle will begin anew.
 Read more
articles.title: Wilmot Works It Out is the picture puzzle sequel to the wonderful warehouse sim - here's a demo

articles.author: James Archer
articles.description:
Sorry everyone, I might have to start doing that Token RPS Starfield Liker thing again. The Shattered Space expansion, out on September 30th, probably won’t refurbish the RPG’s reputation as an overall miss – but it does ditch the proc-gen planet bloat for a single handcrafted hellhole, a true Bethesda speciality honed by years of Fallouts and Elder Scrollseses. And, if its - sadly hands-off - Gamescom showcase is any indication, it might just double down on Starfield’s own strengths as well.
Read more
articles.title: Starfield: Shattered Space looks like a wise return to Bethesda basics

articles.author: James Archer
articles.description:
We’ve apparently never written about Atomfall, an oversight I’m now all too happy to correct, having played a promising forty minutes or so at Gamescom 2024. In development at Sniper Elite makers Rebellion, it’s a "survival-action game inspired by real-life events" – specifically the Windscale fire, which in 1957 coated much of northern England in radioactive fallout. Atomfall’s alternative history makes Britain’s worst nuclear disaster even more disastrous, plunging the realm into full-on post-apocalyptica and leaving your good amnesiac self to dodge death with nothing but a cricket bat and whatever you can scrounge out of sheds. I like it! Mostly.
Read more
articles.title: Atomfall plays like a S.T.A.L.K.E.R. with Scouse accents

articles.author: Edwin Evans-Thirlwell
articles.description:
I've never really understood the charm of ultrawide monitors. I dare boldly to maintain that there is such a thing as Too Wide, a point beyond which the extra visual estate becomes a waste of electricity, unless you watch the screen in pairs. I can only assume people who use ultrawide monitors live in constant terror of flanking manoeuvres and demand the maximum amount of peripheral vision. Mind you, I tend to play games with my nose about 10 centimetres from the screen. Forget being flanked - it's the prospect of snipers up ahead I'm worried about.
If you're among the people who fret excessively about flankers, I've got great news from Uncle BioWare. Forthcoming RPG Dragon Age: The Veilguard will support 21:9 ultrawide monitors. The ultrawide functionality extends to cinematics - you can disable "cinematic aspect ratios" to switch off the black bars that otherwise hem in the view. It's one of several PC-specific flourishes they've just blogged about. Have a look.
 Read more
articles.title: BioWare detail Dragon Age: The Veilguard's PC-specific graphics features and controller options

articles.author: Edwin Evans-Thirlwell
articles.description:
Gamescom is exploding all around us, but there is still time to lower a pincer into the pile of Steam indie game announcements and reel up the occasional treasure. In this case, it's the demo for Cupiclaw, which is possibly the first ever "roguelike deckbuilding claw machine game". You know how Balatro made you feel about Joker cards? Well, this game wants to make you feel the same about claw machines. It's a terrible turn of events, frankly. I'm sorry for inflicting yet another potential bingeplay upon you. Here's a trailer. 
Read more
articles.title: Cupiclaw wants to do for claw machines what Balatro did for poker

articles.author: Nic Reuben
articles.description:
Our James recently stormed off to Cologne after having one too many kills stolen by Edwin in Warhammer 40,000: Space Marine 2. “I’m never even going to look at another videogame again!”, he declared. Unfortunately for James, he accidentally walked straight into Gamescom. “I’m starting to think that there are a lot of video games” he informed us yesterday. Horrifying if true. Still, it does sound like he’s managing to have some fun there, mainly by hitting up Saber Interactive COO and former id Software co-owner Tim Willits for some top tips on how to avenge Edwin’s thieving ways.
Tips about kill-stealing aside, James found time to ask Willits about Space Marine 2's microtransactions, and whether there was any nervousness returning to a cult hit series… especially one a lot of people had almost given up on ever seeing again. “Even the “push forward” combat of the original was part of [id’s] inspiration when we created Doom 2016,” answered Willits. “So for me personally, it’s this huge circle. It’s always intimidating working on a franchise that people love.” But, with the right team, technology, and vision he says, “it just comes together.”
Read more
articles.title: Saber boss explains Space Marine 2's microtransactions: “People don’t want to be sold horse armour anymore"

articles.author: Edwin Evans-Thirlwell
articles.description:
I genuinely don't like sucker-punching video games the second they're announced, but playing Glowmade's King Of Meat is three hours of my life I won't get back, and every second I spend writing about it extends that total, dragging me closer to a regretful demise. Here's the stuff I'm more positive about: buried at the core of this spurting interactive snarkfest there is a moderately OK third-person dungeon-crawler for groups of up to four.
Read more
articles.title: Dire comedy bloodsport King Of Meat should have been called King Of Meme

articles.author: Ed Thorn
articles.description:
Now, I never played quite as much as our Brendy did of the original Splitgate. But I had a fun time with its mixture of Halo-esque trigger pulling and portalling around! So I was intrigued to give the alpha version of Splitgate 2 a go and see if it had a little more substance to it than its initial reveal, which gave off a, "it's Splitgate but with more money" feel. 
Well, I think it's… a bit serious? It certainly has more polish and some extra additions, yet I didn't come away from it thrilled by its more competitive, class-based FPS leanings. I think it just needs a bit more time, perhaps, for a portal to open and some silly rocket launchers and baseball bats and zombies to come tumbling out of it.
Read more
articles.title: Splitgate 2 remains a portal-hopping FPS delight, but it really needs to lighten up

articles.author: Ed Thorn
articles.description:
Marvel Rivals, Netease' free-to-play Overwatch wannabe comprised of superheroes from the Marvelverse, is set to launch on December 6th. And in a "hah, take this Overwatch!" way, they've also announced that all of its heroes will be unlocked for everyone straight off the bat (man). Oh no wait, he's DC isn't he. To be fair, I've only watched one Avengers film, two Captain Americas, and Thor: Ragnarok (without seeing the other Thors). All of which I have zero recollection of. Anyway, yes, Marvel Rivals.
Read more
articles.title: Netease gloatingly note that Overwatch-like Marvel Rivals won't make you unlock heroes, unlike Overwatch 2

articles.author: Edwin Evans-Thirlwell
articles.description:
If you have experience of the London rental market, there's only one way you can react to a game – a French game, no less, the product of a country where two-bed apartments apparently grow on trees – that promises to maroon you in a sprawling labyrinth of flats. “Haha, alright for some!” you chortle despairingly, after freeing yourself from the laundry basket and retrieving your trousers from the fridge. “I bet labyrinths have more than one window,” you sob, as you yet again tackle the problem of opening the front door without becoming part of the wall. 
If you have have experience of the London rental market, you are probably reading this and thinking: “He’s got a front door? Such extravagance. I live in a folded umbrella.” Touché, my friend. I guess it’s just as well we have spaciously proportioned first-person puzzle adventures to console us in our time of compound elbow bruises, rising damp and preposterous financial debt. On which note, Looking For Fael seems fun. 
 Read more
articles.title: In first-person Myst-alike Looking For Fael you’re stuck in a surreal apartment maze, but you do get a Game Boy Advance SP

articles.author: Brendan Caldwell
articles.description:
Lo, a ripple in the release date sands. Stand still a moment while we study this phenomenon. Yes, yes, it is the unmistakable rumble of a large survival MMO pondering its release date. Dune: Awakening is having a think and has decided "early 2025" is a good non-specific time period to come out in early access. That could mean January or February. Or March, I guess. April? Now don't be silly, that's spring. Not April, surely. This beast seems hungry. It will eat before then. I have foreseen it. Mostly by watching the trailer that dropped at Gamescom.
Read more
articles.title: Dune Awakening will burst out of the early access sands in "early 2025"

articles.author: Graham Smith
articles.description:
Vampire: The Masquerade - Bloodlines 2 has been delayed yet again, pushing the troubled RPG into the first half of 2025. Publishers Paradox Interactive and developers The Chinese Room say the delay will allow them to continue to polish the game, respond to feedback, and expand on its story.

 
Read more
articles.title: Vampire: The Masquerade - Bloodlines 2 has been delayed again, this time until the first half of 2025

articles.author: Graham Smith
articles.description:
Arc Raiders was announced back in 2021 as a free-to-play co-op third-person shooter, and has been delayed several times since. That's partly because Embark Studios' other in-development game, The Finals, progressed faster than planned and stole its momentum. It's also because it was re-tooled at some point as a PvPvE extraction shooter.

Now it's back again, aiming for release next year, and it's been re-tooled a little more: it's no longer free-to-play.

 
Read more
articles.title: Arc Raiders, extraction shooter from The Finals' devs, is no longer free-to-play and coming 2025

articles.author: Graham Smith
articles.description:
Here's the news: there's a new Mafia game, it's called Mafia: The Old Country, and it's set in 20th century Sicily rather than in America as per the previous three games in the series.

That's about all we know, but hop below and you'll find a trailer.

 
Read more
articles.title: Mafia: The Old Country coming in 2025, taking the series to early 20th century Sicily

articles.author: Nic Reuben
articles.description:
Oh, and new Indiana Jones And The Great Circle trailer! Great. I’ve been looking forward to a nice, juicy chunk of extended gameplay. You know, something to really convey the flow of the game, rather than the admittedly impressive but nonetheless very fragmented snippets we’ve gotten so far. Now to sit back and…oh, wait. Hang on. It’s just actor Troy Baker telling me about all the great acting he’ll be doing. It is great, by the way. He’s doing a fantastic job. Maybe just, you know, a crumb of acknowledgement or elucidation over the whole ‘interactivity’ part?
Anyway, don’t mind me. I’m just an old fool who likes to press buttons. And, to be fair, it's not like Machinegames don't have a great track record. Anyway, here’s some good news: The game releases December 9th this year. Have a release date trailer.
Read more
articles.title: Indiana Jones And The Great Circle releases December 9th, will hopefully contain gameplay by that point

articles.author: Nic Reuben
articles.description:
Little Nightmares DNA runs strong in Tarsier Studios’ new game. So much so, in fact, that I’d assumed the trailer I watched during an online preview event last week was for a new entry in the horror cinematic-platformer series, right up until the name Reanimal appeared on the screen - shortly followed by a snippet of voiced dialogue.
It’s not just the horror setting, but the Grimm’s fairytale threat, the distorted adults-made-monsters through the trauma-tinged lens of a child’s imagination. A long-limbed man riding a bicycle in a threadbare suit chases children down an alley. A gangly, bowler-hatted pursuer scuttles down a long table like a spider. It's familiar enough territory, at least at first glance. But when Tarsier have a body of work subconsciously scarred by phantasms this vivid, recurring nightmares are just as potent.
Read more
articles.title: Little Nightmare studio’s Reanimal is a creepy co-op adventure inspired by Wind Waker and Silent Hill 2

articles.author: Ed Thorn
articles.description:
There are unexpected things in life, like when one of the recipes in my Gousto box (basically Hello Fresh) didn't come packed with a key ingredient: a single red pepper. Devastating, especially since it's only ever happened to me once. Anyway, this is a long but no less meaningful segue to a game from the Far: Changing Tides and Lone Sails devs Okomotive that's just been announced at this year's Geoffcom show. It's called Herdling and it's nothing to do with sailing across a decaying universe, but very much to do with alpine expeditions and friendly beasts. Very unexpected.
Read more
articles.title: Herdling sees you guide some loveable beasts towards a mysterious summit

articles.author: Edwin Evans-Thirlwell
articles.description:
MachineGames have made a decent living as the creators of satirical alternate histories in which you messily murder Nazis using mighty double-handfuls of shotgun. There are Nazis to fight in Indiana Jones And The Great Circle - a globe-trotting, tomb-robbing adventure featuring a Lost Ark-era Harrison Ford - but as you'd expect from a Lucasfilm adaptation, there's rather less of the bloodshed. 

 
Read more
articles.title: Indiana Jones And The Great Circle is both a more "relaxed" Wolfenstein and Riddick plus Nazis

articles.author: Edwin Evans-Thirlwell
articles.description:
Peter Molyneux is once again back from the beyond, and he's making a new god sim. The game in question is Masters Of Albion, which now has a page on Steam. In development at Molyneux's 2012-founded studio 22cans, it looks like a mix of Populous and Black & White with knocked-together, toylike visuals, and a loose tower-defence format whereby monsters attack your villages at night. Here's the first trailer.
 Read more
articles.title: Peter Molyneux is back with new god sim Masters Of Albion, which looks like a stripped-down Black & White

articles.author: Nic Reuben
articles.description:
Fine, that was slightly mean of me. There’s clearly at least fifteen people still playing Starfield, and Bethesda are today rewarding their commitment with a free buggy named the Rev-8. Today! It actually looks pretty nifty. With it, you’ll be able to hop, jump, and skip the tedious ballache that was hoofing it across the RPG’s needlessly large planets. Here’s a looksie:
Read more
articles.title: All five of you will get a free buggy when you next boot up Starfield

articles.author: Edwin Evans-Thirlwell
articles.description:
Firaxis and 2K Games have slapped a release date on Civilization 7, the latest in the obscenely venerable empire management series. It's out 11th February 2025. Find a new trailer with a quick-and-dirty montage of units, buildings and posturing historical celebs below. Don't worry, it still has hexagons.
Read more
articles.title: Firaxis announce Civilization 7 release date alongside new trailer full of nukes, Wonders and period celebs

articles.author: Nic Reuben
articles.description:
ARPG (not to be confused with action RPG, the comments inform me) Path Of Exile 2 will release in early access November 15th, 2024.
Grinding Gear Games have been set on a November window for a while now, but this is the first time they’ve nailed down a date, and possibly clicked on it a bunch of times to show how serious they are. Do a game related verb I can’t accurately name because I never played past that beach at the beginning of the first game, and do it in the general direction of the trailer below. Watch it. Just watch it.
 
Read more
articles.title: Path Of Exile 2 will release in early access November 15th

articles.author: Edwin Evans-Thirlwell
articles.description:
There's a new instalment of Supermassive's Dark Pictures anthology series on the way, and it's set in Outer Space, wherein you'll find the Darkest Pictures of all. Out in 2025, Directive 8020 is the story of the good ship Cassiopeia, a human colony vessel that is infiltrated by Something Icky. The Something Icky is capable of mimicking humans. So that'd be a bit like Alien and a bit like The Thing, then. Sorry, human colonists!
Directive 8020 was teased at the end of the last Dark Pictures instalment, 2022's The Devil in Me. A trailer also leaked back in November 2022. Now, we have an official announcement video.
  
Read more
articles.title: Supermassive's next Dark Pictures horror game Directive 2080 is out 2025, and looks like Alien meets The Thing

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Ondřej Surý)
articles.description: Nová verze DNS serveru BIND 9.20.0 přináší významná vylepšení po dvou letech vývoje. Klíčové novinky zahrnují nové aplikační a databázové jádro, optimalizovanou podporu DNSSEC a vylepšenou kompresi DNS jmen.
articles.title: BIND 9.20: vylepšený výkon resolveru a nové databázové a aplikační jádro

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Jiří Sluka)
articles.description: Pravidelná středeční sonda do světa software. Dnes se podíváme na SQL klienta, budeme zkoumat elementy testovaných aplikací a nakonec si zaznamenáme čas strávený na projektech.
articles.title: Softwarová sklizeň (4. 9. 2024): mějte své databáze pevně v rukou

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Pavel Tišnovský)
articles.description: Grafické karty EGA a VGA byly postaveny na konceptu takzvaných bitových rovin. To si vyžádalo podporu různých čtecích a zápisových režimů, jež sice komplikovaly programování, ovšem přinesly velmi rychlé přenosy v rámci video RAM.
articles.title: Skrytá síla karty VGA: čtecí a zápisové režimy

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Monika Kutějová)
articles.description: Podíváme se na zneužití chyb v prohlížečích Chrome a Safari, botnetové útoky skrze IP kamery, quishingovou kampaň využívající Microsoft Sway a nové útoky čínské skupiny Volt Typhoon.
articles.title: Postřehy z bezpečnosti: chyby v prohlížečích a nová quishingová kampaň

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Filip Zatloukal)
articles.description: ElasticSearch a Kibana jsou znovu k dispozici pod open-source licencí. Aktualizace od společnosti Microsoft narušila nastavení dualbootu pro uživatele Linuxu na počítačích, kde byl povolen Secure Boot.
articles.title: Aktualizace Microsoftu narušila spouštění Linuxu, Kibana je znovu open source

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: David Ježek)
articles.description: Šest týdnů do uvedení Plasmy 6.2, známe poslední novinky, Microsoft vylepšuje D3D12 akceleraci videa v Mesa, VKD3D 1.13 též vylepšuje Direct3D 12 API nad Vulkanem, QR kernel panic postavený na Rustu.
articles.title: Kernel panic s QR v Linuxu 6.12, neshody Rust vývojářů se správci částí jádra

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: David Ježek)
articles.description: Vrtal mi hlavou tripple buffering v KDE i GNOME a jeho vliv na plynulost desktopu se starými CPU+GPU Intel. Nakonec mě toto téma dovedlo k přesvědčení, které shrnuje název dnešního povídání.
articles.title: Čtyřjádrový procesor už na linuxový desktop přestává stačit

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Pavel Tišnovský)
articles.description: Budeme se zabývat důležitou problematikou, konkrétně jak vybrat co nejvhodnější model, jak nastavit hyperparametry modelů a jak vlastně zjistit, které atributy se mají použít při tréninku modelu.
articles.title: Křížová validace modelů v knihovně scikit-learn

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Karel Burda)
articles.description: Článek se věnuje ohrožení kryptografie kvantovými počítači. Je v něm vysvětlena bezpečnost kryptosystémů, možnosti kvantových počítačů a uvedeny nové kryptosystémy odolné vůči útokům kvantovými počítači.
articles.title: Kvantové počítače zatím kryptografii neohrožují, nové algoritmy ale vznikají

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Filip Zatloukal)
articles.description: Sonda do světa otevřeného softwaru. Dnes si vyzkoušíme zajímavý webový prohlížeč, vyzkoušíme aplikaci pro sdílení souborů přes místní síť, necháme si zobrazit oznámení z GitHubu na ploše a přeložíme si pár textů.
articles.title: Softwarová sklizeň (28. 8. 2024): sdílejte soubory pohodlně po místní síti

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: David Ježek)
articles.description: Otevřený firmware Coreboot v nové verzi 24.08 podporuje tři desítky dalších desek, kde mezi těmi uživatelsky běžně kupovanými najdeme ASRock Fatal1ty Z87 Professional, Z87E-ITX, Z87M OC Formula, Z97E-ITX/ac či Gigabyte GA-H61M-S2P-R3 a notebook HP EliteBook 8560w. Celkově více než 900 patchů od více než 130 vývojářů stojí i za opravou řady chyb.
articles.title: Coreboot 24.08 přidává 31 základních desek a počáteční podporu Intel Panther Lake

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: David Ježek)
articles.description: Příslušný Wayland protokol xx-color-management-v4 pro správu barev (color management) je již součástí kandidáta na vydání ostré verze kompozitoru GNOME Mutter 47. Shrnuje řadu pull requestů implementujícíh podporu pro barevné prostory sRGB a PQ+Bt.2020 (Perceptual Quantize).
articles.title: GNOME Mutter 47 přinese správu barev na Waylandu a opravu EGLDevice pro starší GeForce

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: David Ježek)
articles.description: Zatímco s JPEG XL se Google moc nezabývá, AVIF má u něj stále lépe a lépe ustláno. Po jinak běžně Googlem podporovaném formátu WebP, ovdozeném od WEbM videa, tedy komprese VP8/VP9, nyní do vyhledávání Googlu nyní přibývá podpora obrázků ve formátu AVIF.
articles.title: Google přidává podporu AVIF do vyhledávání

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Petr Krčmář)
articles.description: Byla objevena zranitelnost v kryptografické knihovně společnosti Infineon, která se používá v zařízeních YubiKey řady 5 a Security Key Series s firmwarem před verzí 5.7.0 a YubiHSM 2 s firmwarem před verzí 2.4.0. Společnost Yubico potvrdila dopad na její bezpečnostní tokeny, závažnost ohodnotila stupněm střední.
articles.title: Chyba v knihovně Infineon ohrožuje soukromé klíče z tokenů YubiKey a dalších zařízení

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Redakce)
articles.description: VPN umožňuje bezpečně propojit různá zařízení pomocí šifrovaných tunelů. Umožňuje také zapojit uživatele do vnitřní sítě přes zabezpečený přístupový bod. Na školení si prakticky ukážeme, jak to celé nastavit a zprovoznit pomocí nejnovějšího protokolu WireGuard.
articles.title: WireGuard: nasazujeme VPN rychle a jednoduše (školení)

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: bkralik)
articles.description: Ač to podle počasí nevypadá, prázdniny skončily. Nesmutněte však, neboť již tento čtvrtek bude Virtuální Bastlírna - setkání elektroniků, bastlířů, ajťáků a všech milovníků techniky! Jaké novinky a témata tam čekají?
articles.title: Virtuální Bastlírna vol. 42: nový mikrokontrolér od Raspberry Pi Foundation

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: David Ježek)
articles.description: Vývojáři Intelu svižně dokončují podporu druhé velké generace svých GPU. Pod názvem Battlemage se snad skutečně objeví plnohodnotné grafické karty, ne jen integrovaná jádra (ač o tom stále kromě neoficiálních zvěstí nemáme informace), nicméně dále vyvíjená podpora v Linuxu a projektech souvisejících naznačuje, že tento projekt Intel k ledu nedal.
articles.title: Podpora pro Intel Battlemage v Linuxu 6.12 a Mesa 24.3 finišuje

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: David Ježek)
articles.description: Mnoho novinek ve Firefoxu 130 věru co do počtu není, ale dvě z nich potěší našince z Česka i Slovenska. Firefox 130 přináší podporu překladů dílčích částí webových stránek, které již samy jako celek byly přeloženy. V překladech ve Firefoxu pak mezi novými 11 jazyky nalezneme i češtinu a slovenštinu. Mozilla zde nijak, na rozdíl od jiných, nesleduje, co si uživatel nechává přeložit.
articles.title: Firefox 130 vylepšuje překlady stránek, nově umí i češtinu a slovenštinu

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: David Ježek)
articles.description: Rawtherapee 5.11 je už více než týden venku a konečně se z domovského webu projektu dozvídáme soupis novinek. Mezi nimi nechybí například přechod na skutečný HiDPI režim zobrazení (kde je potřeba), nastavitelnou hodnotu maximálního zoomu v editoru, možnost nechat si při prohlížení fotek zobrazit v daném adresáři i jeho podadresáře.
articles.title: Rawtherapee 5.11 přechází na libraw a přináší vylepšení prakticky ve všech nástrojích

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Jan Fikar)
articles.description: Play Store na Androidu byl doposud při aktualizaci více aplikací pomalý. Aktualizoval aplikace po jedné, vždy čekal, až se předchozí aplikace stáhne a nainstaluje.
articles.title: Play Store na Androidu bude nyní aktualizovat až tři aplikace současně

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Jan Fikar)
articles.description: Téměř před rokem se v jádře 6.8 objevil první ovladač napsaný v Rustu. Šlo o síťovou kartu Asix AX88796B. Do jádra 6.12 se chystá další ovladač a je to opět síťová karta.
articles.title: Další síťová karta bude mít jaderný ovladač v Rustu

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Jan Fikar)
articles.description: Žebříčků populárnosti programovacích jazyků existuje spousta. Server ZDNET vytvořil svůj žebříček tak, že dal dohromady výsledky devíti známých indexů. Jsou tu tři Stack Overflow, tři IEEE, PYPL, Tiobe a GitHub.
articles.title: Nejpopulárnější programovací jazyky podle ZDNET: Python, JavaScript a Java

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Redakce)
articles.description: Proxmox je moderní virtualizační platforma, která v mnoha případech může nahradit VMware. Je open-source, zdarma a je postaven na otevřených technologiích jako KVM, LXC, CEPH a dalších. Pokud potřebujete provozovat virtualizaci, Proxmox je pro vás ideální stack a na našem workshopu Proxmox se dozvíte, jak na něj.
articles.title: Proxmox: moderní virtualizační platforma schopná nahradit VMware (školení)

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Petr Krčmář)
articles.description: V roce 2021 byly vyhledávací nástroj ElasticSearch a vizualizační platforma Kibana přelicencovány pod nesvobodnou licencí SSPL (Server Side Public License). Nyní společnost Elastic oznámila, že tyto projekty budou distribuovatelné také pod licencí Affero GPL.
articles.title: ElasticSearch a Kibana se opět stávají svobodným softwarem

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Petr Krčmář)
articles.description: Světoznámý zpravodajský web AnandTech oznámil, že po 27 letech ukončil svou činnost. Web, který v roce 1997 začal jako technologický blog jednoho mladého nadšence, se postupem času stal jedním z nejznámějších médií zaměřených na počítačové komponenty. Přinášel mnoho velmi podrobných recenzí a užitečných technických informací.
articles.title: Zpravodajský server AnandTech po 27 letech končí

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Petr Krčmář)
articles.description: Organizátoři konference LinuxDays ukončil veřejné přihlašování přednášek. Teď je na vás, abyste vybrali nejlepší témata. Hlasovat můžete do pondělí 9. září. Poté podle výsledků hlasování organizátoři sestaví program pro letošní ročník.
articles.title: Hlasujte o tématech pro letošní ročník LinuxDays

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Adam)
articles.description: MikroTik na svém youtubovém kanále a na fóru oznámil první veřejnou betaverzi administrační aplikace pro routery WinBox 4. Aplikace je určená pro konfiguraci routerů a switchů se systémem RouterOS. Hlavní novinkou je především nativní podpora UI pro systémy Windows, Linux a macOS, na kterou se dle článku na fóru čekalo 15 let.
articles.title: MikroTik oznámil betaverzi konfiguračního nástroje WinBox verze 4

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Jan Fikar)
articles.description: V Epic Store je možné zdarma získat Fallout Classic Collection, což je Fallout, Fallout 2 a Fallout Tactics.
articles.title: Fallout, Fallout 2 a Fallout Tactics zdarma v Epic Store

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Jan Fikar)
articles.description: Mirko Pavleski ze Severní Makedonie minulý týden zveřejnil návod, jak vyrobit jednoduché a levné internetové rádio s ESP32.  Použije k tomu CrowPanel 2.8"-ESP32 HMI 320×240, což je dotyková obrazovka s ESP32 v ceně asi 15 dolarů. K tomu Li-pol baterii, reproduktor a vypínač a to je všechno.
articles.title: Internetové rádio s ESP32 a Yoradio

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Jan Fikar)
articles.description: Před pěti lety Microsoft vydal písmo Cascadia Code pod licencí Open Font, které je určeno pro terminál nebo editory kódu. Používá jej také Windows Terminal. Nyní pokračuje s dalším vylepšováním písma a ve středu zveřejnil font Cascadia Next.
articles.title: Microsoft připravuje písmo Cascadia Next

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Jan Fikar)
articles.description: Nedávno vyšlo Raspberry Pi 5 s 2 GB RAM. Kromě menší paměti a ceny má také SoC Broadcom BCM2712 s označením D0. Ten by měl mít odstraněny nepotřebné věci.
articles.title: Nové Raspberry Pi 5 s 2 GB RAM má o 0,8–0,9 W menší spotřebu

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: asdf.root)
articles.description: Polská společnost Teonite vyvinula open-source aplikaci Defguard postavenou na WireGuardu s implementací MFA/2FA včetně podpory YubiKey. Další výhodou je možnost napojení na LDAP a podpora SSO.
articles.title: Defguard: WireGuard s podporou MFA/2FA

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Jan Fikar)
articles.description: Včera, po mírném zpoždění, vyšlo Ubuntu 24.04.1 LTS, včetně všech oficiálních variant Kubuntu, Ubuntu Budgie, Ubuntu MATE, Lubuntu , Ubuntu Kylin, Ubuntu Studio, Xubuntu, Edubuntu , Ubuntu Cinnamon a Ubuntu Unity. Detaily naleznete v poznámkách k vydání.
articles.title: Vyšlo Ubuntu 24.04.1 LTS, uživatelé 22.04 mohou aktualizovat

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Jan Fikar)
articles.description: Na YouTube se již před čtyřmi roky objevilo zvláštní video, které má pomoci odstranit vodu z mobilního telefonu. Pokud vám spadne telefon do vody, tak prý stačí přehrát na největší hlasitost dvouminutové video s nízkými tóny a voda se dostane ven, obzvláště okolo reproduktorů.
articles.title: Video na YouTube odstraní vodu z mobilního telefonu

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Redakce)
articles.description: Získejte obecný přehled o současných technikách strojového učení a naučte se programovat základní řešení ML pomocí open-source knihoven Sciki-Learn a TensorFlow v jazyce Python. Absolvujte ucelenou pětidenní sérii workshopů strojového učení, kde nejsou potřeba žádné předchozí znalosti umělé inteligence.
articles.title: Bootcamp strojového učení: praktické aplikace z oblastí zpracování obrazu, textu a časových řad (školení)

articles.author: Redakce
articles.description: Ness Czech spouští nový inovační datový hub pro střední a východní Evropu. Fortinet rozšiřuje bezpečnostní platformu pro ochranu kyberneticko-fyzikálních systémů. Umělá inteligence předvídá zločin a odhalí i ukrytou zbraň. Budoucnost podnikové umělé inteligence není o větším množství dat. Red Hat na podporu svých implementačních partnerů rozšířil partnerský program.
articles.title: Týden na ITBiz: Budoucnost podnikové umělé inteligence není o větším množství dat

articles.author: Redakce
articles.description: Nový objev ve světě polovodičů: Vědci potvrdili existenci další modifikace uhlíku. Black Hole Moon: Máme tu další nápad, jak by mimozemské civilizace mohly čerpat energii z černých děr. Vodu v hlubinách Marsu nepřeceňovat.
articles.title: Týden na ScienceMag.cz: Technosignatury se možná dají snadno přehlédnout

articles.author: Reklama
articles.description: Slevy v akci Back to School pokračují. Jedna ze stránek, která poskytuje nejlepší nabídku a je také spolehlivá, je Goodoffer24.com. Zde jsou ceny které se vymykají, zvláště pro operační systém Microsoft, a to jak pro současnou verzi, tak předchozí, a také jak pro verze Pro či Home. A dále také, s exkluzivním kódem, můžete získat další 30% slevu, abyste se mohli těšit z doživotních licencí. Nebo jinak, platíte jen jednou a můžete zapomenout na problémy.
articles.title: Slevy na Goodoffer24 Back to School až 91 %: Windows 11 jen za €20, Office za €24!

articles.description: Acronis představuje novou verzi Acronis True Image na českém trhu. Prodej podnikového softwaru vzrostl v roce 2023 o 12 %. Vědci vyvinuli metodu detekce jednoatomových defektů v polovodičích. Každá pátá firma zasažena útoky na dodavatelský řetězec hardwaru. České firmy platí po útoků ransomwarem výkupné i 6 milionů Kč.

articles.author: Redakce
articles.description: Navrhují hledat temnou hmotu v neutronových hvězdách. Nová analýza dat z Webbova dalekohledu ukazuje, že s Hubbleovou konstantou nemusí být problém.

articles.author: Redakce
articles.description: V letních měsících byly vydány aktualizace openSUSE Leap a SUSE, FreeBSD, Debianu, na testování zabezpečení zaměřených distribucí Kali a Parrot, dále např. IPFire, EasyOS, Tails či EndeavourOS.

articles.author: Redakce
articles.description: AI působí jako katalyzátor ransomwarových útoků, ale i jako jejich brzda. Hybridní již nejsou pouze cloudy, ale i sítě. Westcom 3D LAB demonstruje možnosti integrace bezpečnostních řešení více dodavatelů. Velké jazykové modely by mohly samy pro sebe generovat programy. A k čemu to může být dobré? Povede umělá inteligence k modernizaci finančních služeb?

articles.description: Ucelený přehled článků, zpráviček a diskusí za minulých 7 dní.

articles.author: Redakce
articles.description: Nový model umělé inteligence odhaluje skrytý jazyk DNA. Antropický princip a problém srovnávání nekonečen. Čeští vědci jako první viděli 3D strukturu organického materiálu staršího než Země.
articles.title: Týden na ScienceMag.cz: Gravitační vlny by dokázaly prozradit používání warpových pohonů

articles.author: Ladislav Hagara
articles.description: Na čem aktuálně pracují vývojáři webového prohlížeče Ladybird? Byl publikován přehled vývoje za srpen (YouTube).

articles.author: Ladislav Hagara
articles.description: Společnost Yubico potvrdila bezpečnostní problém YSA-2024-03 svých tokenů YubiKey 5 a Security Key s firmwarem do verze 5.7, YubiKey Bio s firmwarem do verze 5.7.2 a YubiHSM 2 s firmwarem do verze 2.4.0. Útočník může z tokenu vytáhnout soukromý ECDSA klíč. Více na stránce EUCLEAK (pdf).
articles.title: Bezpečnostní problém tokenů od společnosti Yubico

articles.author: bkralik
articles.description:
Ač to podle počasí nevypadá, prázdniny skončily. Nesmutněte však, neboť již tento čtvrtek bude Virtuální Bastlírna - setkání elektroniků, bastlířů, ajťáků a všech milovníků techniky! Jaké novinky a témata tam čekají? Nový procesor na trhu zpravidla vzruší jen uživatele PC, největší novinka tohoto měsíce se týká spíše bastlířů. Raspberry vydalo nový procesor RP2350, který je výrazným vylepšením původního RP2040. Kromě Arm Cortex M33 jader skrývá také RISC-V jádra a značné množství zajímavých digitálních periferií. Ač oficiální desky ještě nejsou dostupné, samozřejmě se strahovákům procesor i tak dostal do rukou a možná i do hledáčku elektronových mikroskopů. A poví si i proč má nový Bus Pirate s tímto procesorem lehké trable a jaké zajímavosti se nachází v erratě procesoru.

Tím samozřejmě novinky nekončí - ještě se bastlíři zmíní o novém nativním konfiguračním nástroji pro síťové prvky od Mikrotiku a o podpoře jednovrstvých plošných spojů v Altiu. Protože jsou ale bastlíři, nezapomenou i na čistě hardwarová témata.

Ze světa hardwaru ukáží nejen novinky nebo praktické poznatky ohledně minimalistických sad nářadí, které se dají vždy nosit s sebou, ale i pár lehce "retro" projektů. Vznikla například replika klávesnice k počítači Ondra a ke starým osciloskopům se dá v současnosti koupit emulátor disketové mechaniky, který používá standardní USB flash disky.

A jak je zvykem, mají strahováci nachystaná i obskurní až bizarní témata, kupříkladu simulátor 555 na Attiny, čínské klony karet MIFARE Classic s nedokumentovaným backdoorem nebo velice osobité útržky z legendární knihy Rozeberte si PC.

Příští Virtuální Bastlírna se pod taktovkou projektu MacGyver studentského klubu SiliconHill bude konat ve čtvrtek 5. září od 20:00 minimálně do 22:00 (ale obvykle končí o dost později). Odkaz na konferenci se před samotnou akcí objeví na bastlířské wiki.
articles.title: Virtuální Bastlírna vol. 42: Nový mikrokontrolér od Raspberry Foundation

articles.author: Ladislav Hagara
articles.description: Intel dnes oficiálně představil (YouTube) sérii procesorů Intel Core Ultra 200V.
articles.title: Série procesorů Intel Core Ultra 200V

articles.author: Ladislav Hagara
articles.description: Byl vydán Mozilla Firefox 130.0. Přehled novinek v poznámkách k vydání, poznámkách k vydání pro firmy a na stránce věnované vývojářům. Řešeny jsou rovněž bezpečnostní chyby. Nový Firefox 130 je již k dispozici také na Flathubu a Snapcraftu.

articles.author: Ladislav Hagara
articles.description: Společnost Valve aktualizovala přehled o hardwarovém a softwarovém vybavení uživatelů služby Steam. Podíl uživatelů Linuxu aktuálně činí 1,92 %. Nejčastěji používané linuxové distribuce jsou Arch Linux, Ubuntu, Linux Mint a Manjaro Linux. Při výběru jenom Linuxu vede SteamOS Holo s 40,48 %. Procesor AMD používá 71,96 % hráčů na Linuxu.

articles.description: Z aktuálních globálních statistik společnosti Statcounter: na desktopu má Linux podíl 4,55 %, Firefox 6,66 %, …

articles.author: Ladislav Hagara
articles.description: Knot DNS, tj. open source autoritativní DNS server, byl vydán ve verzi 3.4.0. Přináší DNS over TLS (DoT), XFR over TLS (XoT), …
articles.title: Knot DNS 3.4.0

articles.author: Ladislav Hagara
articles.description: Prezident minulý týden podepsal zákon o veřejné hydrometeorologické službě. Zřízena bude databáze s otevřenými daty o počasí, klimatu, kvalitě vody a ovzduší, která bude zdarma a online přístupná všem občanům.

articles.title: Pozvánka na 203. sraz OpenAltu v Brně

articles.author: Michael Larabel
articles.description: Following yesterday's initial tuning of the "znver5" target for the AMD Zen 5 CPUs with the GCC 15 compiler, several more rounds of compiler tuning/optimizations were merged for benefiting the Ryzen AI 300 series, Ryzen 9000 series desktops, and upcoming EPYC Turin processors...
articles.title: More AMD Zen 5 Tuning/Optimizations Merged For The GCC 15 Compiler

articles.author: Michael Larabel
articles.description: While using the older Qualcomm Snapdragon 8xc Gen 3 (SC8280XP) SoC and not the exciting Snapdragon X1 Elite, Linux kernel patches were posted this week for enabling the Microsoft Surface Pro 9 5G to boot with the mainline kernel...

articles.author: Michael Larabel
articles.description: Mozilla is interested in a Rust-written JPEG-XL image decoder for its memory safety characteristics compared to the existing C++ code they rely on for JPEG-XL image support in Firefox. While Google previously removed JPEG-XL support from Chrome/Chromium, it may be Google that comes to the rescue and writes a Rust-based JPEG-XL image decoder that can then be shipped by Firefox...
articles.title: Mozilla Is Interested In A Rust JPEG-XL Decoder For Firefox & Google Might Develop It

articles.author: Michael Larabel
articles.description: Linux 6.11 introduces block atomic write support including for NVMe and SCSI devices. With a new set of patches posted this week, atomic write support is wired up for the RAID0 MD code...
articles.title: Linux Patches Posted For RAID0 Atomic Write Support

articles.author: Michael Larabel
articles.description: There are six accepted blocker bugs so far for the Fedora 41 Beta and three of them all pertain to Raspberry Pi issues...
articles.title: Raspberry Pi Bugs Currently Make Up Half Of The Fedora 41 Blocker Bugs

articles.author: Michael Larabel
articles.description: Weston 14.0 was released today as the newest feature release for this reference Wayland compositor...
articles.title: Wayland's Weston 14.0 Compositor Released

articles.author: Michael Larabel
articles.description: When it comes to the Rust programming language support within the Linux kernel one of the limitations is that the CPU architecture support isn't as widespread. Currently Rust for Linux supports x86_64, AArch64 (ARM64) little-endian, LoongArch, and RISC-V. While those cover the main targets, POWER is notably missing and many other niche CPU architectures supported by the Linux kernel especially for aging platforms. Patches posted today to the Linux kernel mailing list would extend the Rust support to MIPS...
articles.title: New Patches Bring Rust Linux Kernel Support To MIPS

articles.author: Michael Larabel
articles.description: Google announced today that the Android 15 source code has been released to the Android Open-Source Project (AOSP)...
articles.title: Android 15 Released To The Android Open-Source Project

articles.author: Michael Larabel
articles.description: While there are more than 74k packages available within Debian's package management system for x86_64 systems, not all of the packages are well maintained and a portion of them haven't seen any maintenance/updates in ages. Debian developers have recently begun discussing how to begin removing more of those long unmaintained packages from the archive...
articles.title: Debian Developers Figuring Out Plan For Removing More Unmaintained Packages

articles.description: Intel formally announced their Core Ultra 200V series "Lunar Lake" laptop processors today in Berlin...

This has been merged for Mesa 24.3-devel to have Battlemage discrete GPUs enjoying OpenGL and Vulkan support while it's also marked for back-porting to the Mesa 24.2 stable series...

articles.description: Patches posted to the Linux kernel mailing list today allow for inline tail support within the Flash-Friendly File-System (F2FS). This inline tail support allows for saving space when storing many small files and with reduced I/O can lead to faster data copy times...

In today's next phase of AmpereOne performance benchmarking is looking at how AmpereOne scales across 32, 64, 96, 128, 160, and 192 core counts plus seeing core-for-core at 128 cores how AmpereOne compares to the Ampere Altra Max M128-30 processor. Bavarian Linux PC vendor TUXEDO Computers recently launched the Sirius 16 Gen 2 as a nice workstation/gaming laptop featuring the Ryzen 7 8845HS with Radeon RX 7600M XT discrete graphics.

articles.description:
Fortnite's Marvel collaboration event is full of interesting weapons and well-known characters to talk to, with Shuri's Black Panther Claws being a late addition to the party. While they weren't available during the first few weeks of the event, you can now find them by checking specific chest types during your matches.


Shuri's Black Panther Claws location in Fortnite x Marvel event


Shuri's Black Panther Claws are a drop from Avenger's chests around the Fortnite map. While they're not a guaranteed spawn, they appear about as often as Captain America's Shield, making them likely to spawn after opening a few.


Screenshot by Destructoid


You can also obtain them by defeating players holding the claws. Doing this is particularly helpful for completing Doom's quests, as one of the require…

articles.description:
There is a long list of quests in Fields of Mistria. If you’re wanting to figure out how to complete all of the currently available Request Board quests, we’ve got you covered.


Whether you’ve finished up the main quests, or you’re trying to unlock all of the available recipes, you’ll need to pay regular visits to the Request Board. The quests available here are easy to complete, requiring you to simply bring items to villagers. For those playing in early access and through its updates to version 1.0, here's every Request Board task in Fields of Mistria so far, along with the requirements and rewards. 


How to complete all Request Board quests in Fields of Mistria


Screenshot by Destructoid


Each villager has a selection of items they want, and you’ll need to find these items within th…
articles.title: How complete every Request Board quest in Fields of Mistria

articles.author: Zoey Handley
articles.description:
Gray2RGB recently unveiled their upcoming renovation sim, Low Budget Repairs. In the wake of House Flipper, renovation games are a dime a dozen, but Low Budget Repairs has a unique approach in its astoundingly low standards. It’s coming to PC eventually.


Do you like the satisfaction of a job well done? Too bad, because we’re on a strict budget and time limit here. Low Budget Repairs has you managing your own apartment block in 1990s Poland. You’re going to want to maximize your profits by cutting corners here and there. And everywhere. Dilute paint with water. Throw furniture out the window. Just slap those tiles anywhere. It’s good enough for government work.




This sort of behavior would explain some of the questionable repair work done in… nearly every apartment I’ve moved into. I j…
articles.title: Low Budget Repairs certainly explains a lot of my apartment renovations

articles.author: Filip Galekovic
articles.description:
Helldivers 2 has turned out to be a way, way more complicated game to manage than anyone anticipated to be. This includes its developer, Arrowhead Games, with the team struggling to stay on top of Helldivers 2's problematic meta. A new update, though, is coming, and it's coming soon.


Notably, the current Arrowhead Games CEO, Shams Jorjani, has responded to one player's concerns about the state of the Thermite Grenade, telling them to "see how [they] feel in 2 weeks." This suggests that some manner of balancing will be dropping in within the next 14 days, which puts this potential update well ahead of Arrowhead's prior 60-day rebalancing plan. There's potential for this to be a majorly positive showing, if that's what's really up.




Arrowhead CEO suggests a balancing update is coming ou…
articles.title: A new Helldivers 2 balancing update is coming very soon

articles.author: Sourav Banik
articles.description:
The Nimbus 2001 is an Epic Broomstick skin that you can unlock in Harry Potter: Quidditch Champions but you need to complete some Career challenges first.


Unlocking the Nimbus 2001 is a part of the Dedication Career Challenge that ultimately unlocks the Legendary Firebolt broom. Under this Dedication challenge, you have to complete five challenges under the "PVP Matches" subcategory.


How to get the Nimbus 2001 skin in Quidditch Champions


Screenshot by Destructoid


Here are all the details of the challenge you need to know:


First Challenge



PVP Matches Played (Rookie): Play 10 PVP matches


PVP Matches Played (Pro): Play 30 PVP matches


PVP Matches Played (All-Star): Play 100 PVP matches


PVP Matches Played (Champion): Play 200 PVP matches



Completing these tasks will reward you a total of 1,425 Gold and Legacy Silver Arrow (a rare broomstick skin).


Second Challenge



PVP Bronze Medals: Earn 200 Bronze Medals in PVP mode to earn 75 Gold.



Third Challenge



PVP Silver Medals: Earn 100 Silver Medals in PVP mode to earn 125 Gold.



Fourth Challenge



PVP Gold Medals: Earn 25 Gold Medals in PVP mode to earn 250 Gold.



Fifth Challenge



PVP Platinum Medals: Earn 5 Platinum Medals in PVP mode to earn 300 Gold.



After completing all these five challenges, you unlock the Nimbus 2001 as a group reward.


This broomstick was first shown in Harry Potter: Chamber of Secrets. Lucius Malfoy gifted one to each of Slytherin's Quidditch team for making Draco Malfoy the Seeker of the team that year. The color scheme of the movie adaptation of Nimbus 2001 was black and silver.

The post How to unlock Nimbus 2001 in Harry Potter: Quidditch Champions appeared first on Destructoid.
articles.title: How to unlock Nimbus 2001 in Harry Potter: Quidditch Champions

After the reasonably successful Syntax Error DLC, Payday 3 players can already look forward to a big new update that's on the horizon. The aptly titled Fear & Greed DLC represents the first half of Payday 3's first anniversary content drop, and honestly, it's looking mighty fine indeed.


Set and primed to release on September 16, the first half of Payday 3's anniversary content update includes the Fear & Greed DLC and a fancy batch of free goodies. To celebrate the occasion and get some hype going, Starbreeze has cooked up a brutal new gameplay trailer showing off the ins and outs of Fear & Greed. Or, at least, some of them.






Payda…

articles.description:
Unless your name is Todd Anthony Shaw, there's no such thing as being Too Short. What about a 10-minute game, though? If that's not too short for you, you'll want to keep an eye on recently-announced first-person shooter Tamashika. 


Billed as a "fast-paced arcade style corridor shooter," Tamashika comes from quicktequila, the developer behind Lovely Planet. Originally released in 2014, Lovely Planet also fit the description of a surreal FPS in its own way, with a simplistic, low-poly pastel aesthetic that belied its speedy and frantic shooting. 


Tamashika is similarly swift. As for its visuals, well, take a look for yourself:




Also like Lovely Planet, Tamashika doesn't really seem to give a rip about stories and cinematics. The description from quicktequila promises that there are "…
articles.title: Lovely Planet devs reveal psychedelic, short-form FPS Tamashika

articles.author: Kristina Ebanez
articles.description:
It's been a few years since we heard about the makings of a Minecraft movie, bringing the beloved Overworld to life in an entirely new way. Now, it's finally coming to fruition with its first-ever teaser and a release date set for April 4, 2025.


The trailer begins with the misfit ensemble, including Jason Momoa as Garrett "The Garbage Man" Garrison, Danielle Brooks as Dawn, Sebastian Eugene Hansen as Henry, and Emma Myers as Natalie. As an avid Minecraft player, it's interesting to see this live-action cast mixed in with a CGI world, almost reminding me of the film Who Framed Roger Rabbit. Although it may be different from what I expected, it still holds true to Minecraft with its silliness, creativity, and its immersive cubic world.




You'll see iconic mobs from the Overworld, like th…
articles.title: Minecraft Movie teaser blends realism with Overworld’s cubic universe, reveals new release date

articles.author: Zoey Handley
articles.description:
Konami has revealed that it will be publishing Far Out Games’ ludicrous ‘50s delivery game, Deliver At All Costs. It’s coming to PS5, Xbox Series X|S, and PC. No launch date has been announced.


There seem to be a lot of courier games on the horizon, but this is strangely a concept I really enjoy. The trailer starts off normally enough, highlighting the ‘50s theme (they strangely pin it specifically in 1959). There are slow pans, people doing stuff, and a car chase. Then it gets to the actual gameplay, and the player character has a giant marlin in the back of his truck.




Delivery can be fun in a mundane setting, but it can be even better when it leans wackier. Crazy Taxi is just a delivery game when you get down to it. Deliver At All Costs certainly isn’t aiming for realism. The trailer makes a big show of its destruction physics as the truck plows through fences and even buildings. People hang from the sides of the truck in one scene, and in another, the player climbs a steep, treacherous road as boulders tumble onto them.


It looks like a good time. While the high, tilted camera angle isn’t my favorite, it looks like it works for the approach. The trailer already shows off quite a bit of variety in its missions, and there seems to be an underlying narrative serving as a foundation for the chaos.


We’ll see how well Far Out Games can pull it off when Deliver At All Costs comes to PS5, Xbox Series X|S, and PC sometime in the future.

The post Deliver At All Costs looks like it will deliver on its promise appeared first on Destructoid.
articles.title: Deliver At All Costs looks like it will deliver on its promise

articles.author: Madison Benson
articles.description:
Getting Mythic items in Fortnite is a great way to keep yourself strong during matches. If you like weapons with incredibly high fire rates and solid damage output, Gwenpool's Dual Micro SMGs are the way to go. Let's find out how to get these valuable guns for your next match.

Gwenpool's Dual Micro SMGs are a Mythic weapon you can buy from Gwenpool herself. After completing her secret missions, she'll wander around a parking lot directly west of Reckless Railways, where you can talk to her about the situation's aftermath.

articles.author: Jamie Moorcroft-Sharp
articles.description:
Developer Hello Games has finally added fishing to No Man's Sky in its Aquarius Update. The update was, as is tradition, launched after a couple of days of emoji teasers on September 4, 2024. This is a feature fans have longed for in the game for years, and we're all so incredibly happy it's here at last. 


The No Man's Sky Aquarius Update adds a complex fishing system that's linked to every other mechanic in the game. While you could just kick back and relax on a random world and fish, provided there's some water there, you can also engage with a few new systems to make it even more enjoyable. As listed in the update's patch notes, there are new structures to craft, a fishing log to fill, and even an entire fishing Expedition. It's the last one that I'm most excited about. 


Fish around…
